meanings.sent1: The backyard was full of mullock after the storm.
meanings.sent2: The workers cleared the mullock from the construction site.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally stepped in a pile of mullock and slipped comically.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a jumbled mullock of thoughts after the long day.
meanings.sent5: The mullock piled up in the corner, a testament to neglect.

meanings.definition: To make a mess or create disorder.
meanings.sent1: Please don't mullock up your room before guests arrive.
meanings.sent2: The children mullock around with their toys in the living room.
meanings.sent3: He mullocked the papers on his desk, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: The wind mullocked the neatly arranged leaves into a whirlwind.
meanings.sent5: The mischievous puppy mullocked the garden with its playful antics.

meanings.sent1: I hope the rain doesn't mullock our picnic plans.
meanings.sent2: The spilled drink mullocked her new dress.
meanings.sent3: He mullocked his chances of winning by making a critical mistake.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected turn of events mullocked their carefully laid out strategy.
meanings.sent5: The artist accidentally mullocked the painting with a stray brush stroke.
